intro: Kneiffia pumila, commonly known as the dwarf kniphofia, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, tubular flowers. The plant produces dense clusters of bright orange or yellow flowers, which are typically borne on short, upright stems. Kneiffia pumila thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
